prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

response:
```
# Load required libraries
library(readxl)
library(DESeq2)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

# Read count table
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")

# Read annotation data
annotation_data <- read.table("SRP021193.colData.tsv", header = TRUE, sep = "\t")

# Set column names of count table to be gene names
colnames(count_table) <- count_table[,1]
count_table <- count_table[,-1]

# Set row names of annotation data to be sample ids
rownames(annotation_data) <- annotation_data[,1]
annotation_data <- annotation_data[,-1]

# Run statistical tests to find group-specific genes
# Assuming "group" is the column name containing the different groups in the annotation data
groups <- unique(annotation_data$group)
group_specific_genes <- list()
for (group in groups) {
  group_samples <- annotation_data[annotation_data$group == group, rownames(count_table)]
  group_samples <- intersect(group_samples, colnames(count_table))
  group_data <- count_table[, group_samples]
  dds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(countData = group_data,
                                colData = annotation_data,
                                design = ~ group)
  dds <- DESeq(dds)
  res <- results(dds, contrast = c("group", group, "Control"))
  group_specific_genes[[group]] <- rownames(res)[which(res$padj < 0.05)]
}

# Extract PCA-specific count table
pca_specific_count_table <- count_table[group_specific_genes[[1]],]

# Run PCA on the specific count table
pca <- prcomp(t(pca_specific_count_table))

# Extract group information from annotation data
group_colors <- annotation_data$group

# Plot PCA with color coding by group variable
ggplot(data = NULL, aes(x = pca$x[,1], y = pca$x[,2])) +
  geom_point(col = group_colors) +
  xlab("PC1") +
  ylab("PC2") +
  ggtitle("PCA plot of group-specific genes")
```
Please note that for running the statistical tests, you might need to modify the design formula of DESeq2 (`design = ~ group`) to match the actual column name in your annotation data that contains the group information.
